p: Darunavir is a second generation of HIV-1 protease inhibitors. It is a non-peptidic inhibitor of protease that enters itself in the active site of protease through several hydrogen bonds [ 61]. A recent report of an in vitro experiment indicated that using darunavir at a concentration of 300 Î¼M, significantly inhibits SARS-CoV-2 replication. Its inhibition efficiency increased by 280-fold in comparison to the control group [ 44].
